author: Georgina Cruz
title: Events around Florida, July 21-26
text:
0 
Lake Placid: The annual Caladium Festival features entertainment, field bus tours, arts and crafts, sale of bulbs and plants, car and bike show and other activities in Stuart Park on July 24-26. Admission is free. The park is at 49 E. Interlake. Info: lpfla.com/caladium.htm. 
Fort Lauderdale : Buckler's Craft Fair displays handmade creations at the War Memorial Auditorium on July 25-26. Admission is $6 (good for both days with hand stamp) for adults; children 12 and under are free. Parking is free. The War Memorial Auditorium is at 800 NE Eighth St. Event hours are 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Saturday and 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. on Sunday. Info: bucklercraftfair.com. 
St. Augustine Beach: The St. Johns County Pier Park presents Music By The Sea on July 22. One of a series of summer concerts, this week's performer is Mr. Natural, playing Southern rock, country and blues. The music starts at 7 p.m. and admission is free. Dinners priced $10 or less will be available from Panama Hatties. The Pier Park is at 350 A1A South. Info: thecivicassociation.org. 
Cape Coral: The Native Plant Sale at Rotary Park offers a variety of trees, shrubs, plants, seeds and books for sale on July 25. Information on butterfly gardening, backyard wildlife habitats and Florida-friendly landscaping tips will be available. Event hours are 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Admission is free. The Rotary Park Environmental Center is at 5505 Rose Garden Road. Info: fortmyers-sanibel.com.
